dashboard.generator

Class BufferGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • dashboard.generator.Generator
      • dashboard.generator.BufferGenerator

  • public class BufferGenerator
extends Generator
    Implements a Generator that reads text from a file and simulates data transmissions. Intended to be used with StringUpdatables.
    Author:
    Mark Sabini

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BufferGenerator(int interval)
      Creates a BufferGenerator with the specified timing interval

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void generate()
      Updates all the StringUpdatables associated with the BufferGenerator with the next line in the transmission.
      void reset()
      Resets the transmission to the very beginning.
      void setSource(java.lang.String filename)
      Sets the source of the transmission for the BufferGenerator.

      • Methods inherited from class dashboard.generator.Generator

        addReadout, isActive, removeReadout, setActive, setInterval

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferGenerator

        public BufferGenerator(int interval)
        Creates a BufferGenerator with the specified timing interval
        Parameters:
        interval - the time interval between updates, measured in milliseconds

    • Method Detail

      • setSource

        public void setSource(java.lang.String filename)
        Sets the source of the transmission for the BufferGenerator. If the file could not be found, an error message is printed to all StringUpdatables associated with the BufferGenerator.
        Parameters:
        filename - the filename of the source of the transmission

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the transmission to the very beginning.

      • generate

        public void generate()
        Updates all the StringUpdatables associated with the BufferGenerator with the next line in the transmission. If the end of the transmission has been reached, the BufferGenerator will set itself to be inactive.
        Specified by:
        generate in class Generator
